node_2: exhibitors' obligation to show an untitled yash chopra film
edge: Under this arrangement, exhibitors are required to screen an unnamed movie by Yash Chopra's banner on Diwali and keep it in cinemas for at least two weeks afterwards. This move by YRF has been contested by actor Ajay Devgn on grounds of violation of the 2002 Indian Competition Act.

In contrast to JTHJ, which is an untitled Yash Chopra film, SOS (a film starring Ajay Devgn) is an action movie that may appeal more to single screen audiences due to its genre and the fact that it has already been released in cinemas.
Gayatri Sankar of Zee News gave it 3.5 out of 5 stars while commenting 'Overall, SOS is worth a watch, a complete family entertainer.'
Certain portions are a bit of a drag, but the comic sequences will make up for the monotony.
If you liked Wanted, Dabangg and Rowdy Rathore, chances are you will relish Son of Sardaar as well.

node_2: north indian audiences in particular and those residing abroad
edge: Both films were released on 13 November 2012.
Son of Sardaar has a lot for the masses but it lacks a good story.
Comedy is more than just gags and slapstick. Sadly SOS gets it wrong.
The Hindustan Times described Son of Sardaar as 'exhausting, painfully loud and way too long, with too few laughs', indicating a low level of entertainment in the film.
Rajeev Masand of CNN-IBN gave Son of Sardaar 'only sporadically entertaining' and 'peddles the same tired stereotypes of Punjab and Sikhs', highlighting flaws in the film.

Rajeev Masand's statement 'a cameo by Salman Khan, sadly, doesn't make up for the film's many flaws' suggests that Salman Khan's appearance in Son of Sardaar did not significantly improve the quality of the film.

Son of Sardaar had a strong opening with around ₹70% occupancy in multiplexes and similar single screen opening. It earned approximately ₹10.7 crore on its first day, increased by 70% to approximately ₹16 crore net on the second day, resulting in a total of approximately ₹39 crore nett in three days.
The Hindu stated that watching an unfunny film trying to be funny was 'more torturous'.
The movie Son of Sardaar grossed $6.1 million in its first five days of release.
After its extended first-week collection, the movie Son of Sardaar brought its total collection to $9.9 million nett.
In four weeks, the movie Son of Sardaar grossed a total of $13 million.
The movie Son of Sardaar did a business of around $3 million overseas, which BoxofficeIndia.com called it 'Hit'.
In seven days, the movie Son of Sardaar grossed $2 million.
The movie Son of Sardaar has a distributor share of 75 crore.
